original: Emmelin, Carl Oscar Engelbrekt, folkskolinspektör, Jönköping, f. 16/8/ 85 i Ö. Broby, Krist. 1., av folksk:lär. Nils E. o. Caroline Johansson. G. 19 m. Augusta Bergh. Barn: Axel f. 21, jur. stud., Ake 30. — Mog:ex. i Kristianstad 04, fil. kand. i Lund 08, fil. mag. 13, provår i Lund 14, fil. lic. 30. Förest, f. h. folksk. i Malmköping 05, e. o. lär. v. Lunds priv. elementarskola 08-09, vik. adj. v. Fai-köp. samsk. 13, förest, f. tekn. sk. 13, vik. lektor v. Linköp. h. a. 1. 13-15, e. o. le|ktor v. Eskilstuna h. a. 1. 15-18, vik. adj. o. lektor v. folksk :sem. i Sthlm 18-19, rektor v. skeppsgosse-sk. i Marstrand 19-25, ord. adj. i Linköp. 23, vik. lektor 25-26, folksk :insp. f. Jönköp. stad sed. 26, stadsbibi. i Jönköp. 26-39. Led. av stadsfullm. (h) sed. 31, landstingsman sed. 35, ordf. i styr. f. centr :bibl. o. Jönköp. 1. bibl:förb., v. ordf. o. ordf. i Jönköp. 1. bildn:förb., hed :led. där sed. 45, sekr. i Jönköp. distr. av SvRK 40-44, ordf. i styr. f. Jönköp. arb :inst., led. av las :direkt. i Jönköp. m. m. Skr. : Indragningsmakt o. tryckfrihet i Sv:e under den s. k. rabulistperioden (17), Förslag t. kursplan o. metodiska anvisningar f. allm. skolämnen i skeppsgosseskola (flottans skolsaikk, betänk, n 21), Jönköp. stadsbibliotek (28), Till frågan om olika begåvn. o. deras tillgodoseende i folksk. (30), Differentiering — individualisering (32), Kommunala folkbibliotek i Jönköp. 1. (39) m. fl. samt art. o. rec. i tidn. o. tid-skr. RVO.
translated:
Emmelin, Carl Oscar Engelbrekt, school inspector, Jönköping, born on August 16, 1885 in Ö. Broby, Krist. 1., son of the primary school teacher Nils E. and Caroline Johansson. Married in 1919 to Augusta Bergh. They have two children: Axel, born in 1921 and studying law, and Åke, born in 1930. 

Emmelin completed his high school education in Kristianstad in 1904, earned his Bachelor of Arts degree in Lund in 1908, Master of Arts degree in 1913, and completed his probationary year in Lund in 1914. He became a licensed teacher in 1930. 

His career includes serving as the head of a primary school in Malmköping from 1905, a substitute teacher at Lund's private elementary school from 1908-1909, and a temporary teacher at Fai-köp. samsk. in 1913. He headed a technical school in 1913, was a temporary lecturer at Linköping's h. a. l. from 1913-1915, deputy lecturer at Eskilstuna h. a. l. from 1915-1918, temporary teacher and lecturer at the primary teacher's seminary in Stockholm from 1918-1919, rector of the sailor school in Marstrand from 1919-1925, regular lecturer at Linköping in 1923, and temporary lecturer from 1925-1926. From 1926 he was the school inspector for Jönköping stad and from 1926-1939 he was the city librarian in Jönköping. 

Emmelin was a member of the city council (h) from 1931, county councilman from 1935, chairman of the board of the central library and Jönköping's 1st library association, vice-chairman and chairman of Jönköping's 1st portrait photography association, and an honorary member since 1945. He was also the secretary for Jönköping's district of the Swedish Red Cross from 1940-1944, chairman of the board for Jönköping's work institute, and a board member of the county hospital in Jönköping, among other positions. 

Emmelin's publications include "Indragningsmakt o. tryckfrihet i Sv:e under den s.k. rabulistperioden" (17), "Förslag t. kursplan o. metodiska anvisningar f. allm. skolämnen i skeppsgosseskola (flottans skolsaikk, betänk, n 21)", "Jönköp. stadsbibliotek" (28), "Till frågan om olika begåvn. o. deras tillgodoseende i folksk." (30), "Differentiering - individualisering" (32), "Kommunala folkbibliotek i Jönköp. 1." (39), and several articles and reviews in various newspapers and magazines. He was also awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).
